code: @Manual{,   title = {oncokbR: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {Karissa Whiting},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001},   url = {http://www.karissawhiting.com/oncokbR/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: {oncokbR} allows annotate genomic data sets using MSK’s OncoKB Precision Oncology Knowledge Base directly R. package wraps existing OncoKB API endpoints R users can easily leverage existing API annotate data mutations, copy number alterations fusions. package compatible oncoKB data v3.16, subject change new versions released. information oncoKB, see [Chakravarty et al. 2017[(https://ascopubs.org/doi/full/10.1200/PO.17.00011). Gao et al. Sci. Signal. 2013 Cerami et al. Cancer Discov. 2012

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install development version oncokbR like :

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Annotate MAF data tumor type indicated annotations oncogenicity oncoKB treatment levels: can also annotated tumor type data oncogenicity :
code: library(oncokbR) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union blca_mutation <- oncokbR::blca_mutation %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")  annotated_tt <- annotate_mutations(mutations = blca_mutation[1:50,])  annotated_tt %>%   select(oncogenic) %>%    table() #> oncogenic #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                4                1               45 annotated_tt %>%   select(treatments_level ) %>%    table() #> treatments_level #> LEVEL_3B  #>        1 blca_mutation <- oncokbR::blca_mutation  annotated_no_tt <- annotate_mutations(mutations = blca_mutation[1:50,]) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.  annotated_no_tt %>%   select(oncogenic) %>% table() #> oncogenic #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                4                1               45

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: blca_cna <- blca_cna %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")   annotated <- annotate_cna(blca_cna[1:10,]) table(annotated$oncogenic) #>  #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                3                6                1

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: blca_sv <- blca_sv %>%   mutate(tumor_type = "BLCA")   annotated <- annotate_sv(blca_sv[1:10,]) table(annotated$oncogenic) #>  #> Likely Oncogenic        Oncogenic          Unknown  #>                6                3                1

Annotate CNA — annotate_cna
text: cna cna file long format (similar maf file)

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
text: Annotate maf maf-like files using information protein change HGVSg. can annotated tumor types indicated (oncotree codes), without.

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
text: mutations mutations file MAF, similar format annotate_by Can indicate whether annotate "protein_change" "hgvsg (see oncoKB API docs info). "Default protein_change

title: Annotate Mutations — annotate_mutations
code: mutations <- oncokbR::blca_mutation[1:10, ]  # Annotate without tumor type ----- x <- annotate_mutations(mutations) #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.  # Annotate with tumor type -----  # Annotate by HGVSg z <- annotate_mutations(oncokbR::mutations_hgvsg, annotate_by =  "hgvsg") #> ℹ No "tumor_type" found in data. No treatment-level annotations will be returned.

title: Annotate Structural Variants — annotate_sv
text: sv cna file long format (similar maf file)

title: Annotate Structural Variants — annotate_sv
code: sv <- blca_sv[1:10,]  x <- annotate_sv(sv = sv) #> Error in rename(., query_hugo_symbol = "hugo_symbol"): Can't rename columns that don't exist. #> ✖ Column `hugo_symbol` doesn't exist.

title: Annotate Mutations By Protein Change — .annotate_mutations_by_protein_change
code: mutations <- rename_columns(oncokbR::blca_mutation[1:10, ]) %>%     dplyr::mutate(consequence_final_coding = "any") .annotate_mutations_by_protein_change(mutations, annotate_tumor_type = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 10 × 7 #>    type                              title status detail path  message sample_id #>    <chr>                             <chr> <chr>  <chr>  <chr> <chr>   <chr>     #>  1 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000569… #>  2 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000343… #>  3 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000343… #>  4 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000326… #>  5 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000356… #>  6 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000145… #>  7 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000612… #>  8 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000336… #>  9 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000356… #> 10 https://www.oncokb.org/problem/p… Unau… 401    Full … /api… error.… P-000475…

what: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
title: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
text: Internal function recode numeric CNA alteration values factor values

title: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
text: alteration_vector vector CNA alterations coded following levels: neutral, deletion, amplification, gain, loss, homozygous deletion, hemizygous deletion, loh, gain, high level amplification, 0, -1, -1.5, -2, 1, 2.

title: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
text: recoded CNA data set factor alteration values. See details code dictionary

title: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
text: CNA coded following key based key: values "neutral":  "0", "neutral", "deletion": "homozygous deletion", "-2", "deletion": "loh", "-1.5", "deletion": "hemizygous deletion", "-1", "amplification": "gain", "1", "amplification": high level amplification", "2",

title: Internal function to recode numeric CNA alteration values to factor values — recode_cna
code: recode_cna(blca_cna$alteration[1:10]) #>  [1] amplification deletion      amplification deletion      deletion      #>  [6] deletion      deletion      deletion      amplification amplification #> Levels: deletion amplification
